intro: Draba arseniewii, commonly known as the Armenian rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress plants, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sunlight. It produces tiny, rounded seeds that are dispersed by wind, allowing it to colonize new areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Draba arseniewii is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
